revised_title: The Royal Society's Portraits and Busts: A Catalogue and History
tldr: This article provides a detailed catalogue and history of the portraits and busts displayed at the Royal Society's new location in Carlton House Terrace. It highlights the significance of the collection, which includes works of art and depictions of notable figures in the Society's history. The article also mentions gaps in the collection and encourages readers to help fill these gaps by providing information on missing portraits of past presidents.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Art History
